item.title: Experience
item.description: 2014 - Now Research Manager IBM Research Bangalore, KA India At IBM research in Bangalore, I am responsible for research efforts in the areas of application of AI for business process automation and optimization. I lead the team of researchers, data scientists and software engineers to infuse AI into IBM offerings in Automation space. We have 10 published papers in top rated peer-reviewed conferences and journals.

item.title: Papers

Tanmayee Narendra, Prerna Agarwal, Monika Gupta, Sampath Dechu: Counterfactual Reasoning for Process Optimization Using Structural Causal Models, BPM Forum 2019. Neelamadhav Gantayat, Giriprasad Sridhara, Anush Sankaran, Sampath Dechu, Senthil Mani, Gargi Banerjee Dasgupta: *Towards Creating Business Process Models from Images, ICSOC 2018.

item.title: Sampath Dechu
item.description: About my passion and expertise: I am passionate about building technology solutions for boosting employee productivity in enterprises. My expertise lies in design, build and deployment of data-driven computational software solutions and platforms. About my technical experience: I have developed and delivered products that included advanced computational software methods such as: combinatorial search, numerical optimization, graph theory, data mining, statistical inference, natural language procesing, machine learning, deep learning. I have experience of developing cloud-native fullstack applications using MEAN stack in microservice architecture.
